title: Smart Grid Interoperability Panel (SGIP) Announces Extended Early Bird Registration!
text: Smart Grid Interoperability Panel (SGIP) Announces Extended Early Bird Registration! SGIP announces that due to increased registrations, Early Bird Registration is extended until October 2nd. WAKEFIELD, MASSACHUSETTS, USA, September 23,   The Smart Grid Interoperability Panel (SGIP), a member-led consortium that securely accelerates and advances Grid Modernization through interoperability, today announced that they are extending Early Bird Registration to October 2nd, 2015. With 300 attendees expected and speaker program comprised of utility, vendor, and industry senior executives, the SGIP 2015 Annual Conference promises to be filled with the latest in grid modernization and networking opportunities for non-members, members and guests to connect and collaborate. Included in the conference is an exclusive Vendor Expo where vendor, utility and technology partners will demonstrate the interoperability of grid devices and their progress on collaborative microgrid projects. A highlight of the Vendor Expo will be the EnergyIoT™ OpenFMB™ field demonstration, a multi-vendor peer-to-peer demonstration based on three microgrid related use cases driven by the SGIP OpenFMB™ Working Group in collaboration with Duke Energy and 8 other utility members. This is a must-see event for anyone interested in IoT interoperability and grid modernization. The two day summit will be followed by a 1-day hands on Workshop digging into topic details and work efforts to accelerate Grid Modernization activity. To register for the SGIP 2015 Annual Conference just follow normal registration process, the system will automatically discount for Early Bird Registration. Early Bird Registration for this event ends next Friday, October 2nd. In addition, SGIP discounted conference hotel rates also end on October 2nd, 2015. Register here now to get early bird rates for the conference and hotel. About the Smart Grid Interoperability Panel The Smart Grid Interoperability Panel (SGIP) is a consortium that securely accelerates and advances Grid Modernization through interoperability and the leadership talents of its members. SGIP is committed to improving individual quality of life by integrating energy resources securely, intelligently and efficiently. Gabrielle Puccio
